divs: sighting detailsmy brother and his roommate went out on the balcony of their apartment for a cigarette at about 11:45pm. after a few minutes outside, a bright flash caught our eyes. north-east of where we were (the balcony faces north) there was about every second or two at a constant rate there was a bright white flash, brighter than any star or planet that could be seen. this flash was traveling west-north-west -- as could be seen by the space between the locations of each flash. we watched it for a bit, and saw it start to curve in a north or north-north-westerly direction. no other lights, such as red\green lights that are on airplanes, or any other such thing were on it. the one thing that must be pointed out, however is that this was moving at an extremely slow speed, yet there was no drift from what seemed to be the curve stated above. either this object was very high in the sky (which would make the brightness of it stand out even more), or it was at a lower altitude; at that speed, however, i doubt that it would be able to stay in air.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Shakopee
There were no other sightings in Shakopee on or around July 30th 2009
Summary: Bright object brightly flashing across sky
